title: One dead in horror crash
text:
One dead in horror crash at Tamborine Mountain March 19, 2017 10:25am A PERSON has died and another is in a critical condition following a horror car crash Clare Armstrong The Courier-Mail Share on Twitter 
A PERSON has died and another is in a critical condition following a horror car crash on Tamborine Mountain in the Gold Coast hinterland this morning. 
Police said initial information indicated a sedan carrying four people was travelling on Tamborine Mountain Rd near Barry Rd, when the car left the road and ran into a tree just before 6am. 
One of the passengers died at the scene and the driver and two other passengers were trapped inside the vehicle. 
A female passenger was taken to the Princess Alexandra Hospital via helicopter in a critical condition. 
The 19-year-old male driver was taken to Gold Coast University Hospital in a stable condition. 
An 18-year-old male passenger was taken to the Royal Brisbane and Women’s Hospital in a stable condition. 
Traffic diversions are in place and police are asking motorists to avoid the area. 
The Forensic Crash Unit is investigating.
